enWisdom: Hope corrupts [one’s] actions and wastes [one’s] lifetime

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَطُولَ الْأَمَلِ فَكَمْ مِنْ مَغْرُورٍ افْتَتَنَ بِطُولِ أَمَلِهِ وَأَفْسَدَ عَمَلَهُ وَقَطَعَ أَجَلَهُ فَلَا أَمَلَهُ أَدْرَكَ وَلَا مَا فَاتَهُ اسْتَدْرَكَ
enWisdom: Be cautious not to lengthen [your] hope, for many a deceived person has been enticed by his long hope and corrupted his deeds and cut [short] his lifetime, then neither was his hope realized nor was that which he lost regained

Wisdom: إِنَّكُمْ إِنِ اغْتَرَرْتُمْ بِالْآمَالِ تَخَرَّمَتْكُمْ بَوَادِرُ الْآجَالِ وَقَدْ فَاتَتْكُمُ الْأَعْمَالُ
enWisdom: If you are deceived by hopes, you will surely be annihilated by the fast approaching death and will have lost [the opportunity to perform] good deeds
The fruit of hope is corruption of deeds
The deception of hope corrupts [one’s] action
One whose hopes lengthen, his actions become worse
Whoever lengthens his hopes, corrupts his actions
How corrupting is hope for deeds!

Wisdom: مَا أَطَالَ أَحَدٌ فِي الْأَمَلِ إِلَّا قَصَّرَ فِي الْعَمَلِ
enWisdom: No one lengthens his hopes except that he [also] curtails his actions
The smallest of hopes leads to corruption of actions
Whoever shortens his hopes, beautifies his actions
The best assistance for action is curtailing hopes
